biosimulators_gillespy2 package

Submodules

biosimulators_gillespy2.core module

Methods for executing SED tasks in COMBINE archives and saving their
outputs

Author:
   Bilal Shaikh <

   bilalshaikh42@gmail.com

   >

Author:
   Jonathan Karr <

   karr@mssm.edu

   >

Date:
   2020-10-26

Copyright:
   2020, Center for Reproducible Biomedical Modeling

License:
   MIT

class biosimulators_gillespy2.core.Algorithm(name, solver, parameters=None, **solver_args)

   Bases: "object"

   Simulation algorithm

   name

      name

      Type:
         "str"

   solver

      solver

      Type:
         "type"

   solver_args

      solver arguments

      Type:
         "dict"

class biosimulators_gillespy2.core.AlgorithmParameter(name, key, data_type, default)

   Bases: "object"

   Simulation algorithm parameter

   name

      name

      Type:
         "str"

   key

      key

      Type:
         "str"

   data_type

      data type

      Type:
         "type"

   default

      defualt value

      Type:
         "object"

   set_value(solver_args, value)

      Apply the value of a parameter to a data structure of solver
      arguments

      Parameters:
         solver_args (dict) -- solver arguments

         value (object) -- parameter value

class biosimulators_gillespy2.core.HybridTauIntegrationMethod(value)

   Bases: "str", "enum.Enum"

   Hybrid tau integration method

   BDF = 'KISAO_0000288'

   LSODA = 'KISAO_0000088'

   RK23 = 'KISAO_0000537'

   RK45 = 'KISAO_0000032'

   Radau = 'KISAO_0000304'

exception biosimulators_gillespy2.core.InputError(message, expression)

   Bases: "Exception"

   An error with a COMBINE/OMEX archive that prevents its parsing
   and/or simulation

   expression

      Python object which triggered the error

      Type:
         "object"

class biosimulators_gillespy2.core.VodeMethod(value)

   Bases: "str", "enum.Enum"

   VODE method

   adams = 'KISAO_0000289'

   bdf = 'KISAO_0000288'

biosimulators_gillespy2.core.exec_combine_archive(archive_file, out_dir)

   Execute the SED tasks defined in a COMBINE archive and save the
   outputs

   Parameters:
      archive_file (str) -- path to COMBINE archive

      out_dir (str) -- directory to store the outputs of the tasks

biosimulators_gillespy2.core.exec_simulation(model_filename, model_sed_urn, simulation, working_dir, out_filename, out_format)

   Execute a simulation and save its results

   Parameters:
      model_filename (str) -- path to the model

      model_sed_urn (str) -- SED URN for the format of the model
      (e.g., urn:sedml:language:sbml)

      simulation (Simulation) -- simulation

      working_dir (str) -- directory of the SED-ML file

      out_filename (str) -- path to save the results of the simulation

      out_format (str) -- format to save the results of the simulation
      (e.g., csv)

   Returns:
      predicted species counts/concentrations;
         rows: species, columns: time points

   Return type:
      "pandas.DataFrame"

   Raises:
      InputError

       -- if the simulation uses an unsupported format, the model
      could not be imported,     the simulation requires an
      unsupported algorithm or algorithm parameter, or the simulation
      start time is not zero
